      • addTemporaryData

        @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=POST)
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DataRepresentationBackend.Models.Message> addTemporaryData(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                      DataRepresentationBackend.Models.TemporaryData data)
        POST method that add element of the building into the database
        Parameters:
        data - - BodyType: JSon { "elementType" : 6, "room" : "C210", "x1" : 1, "y1" : 2, "x2" : 3, "y2" : 4, "floor" : 5, "isExitWay" : 0, "isExterior": 0 }
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - a Message object and HttpStatus.OK if element is added to database or a ResponseEntity in case of OperationNotSupportedException that contains a significant message and HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST or in case of Exception contains a significant Message and HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR or a ResponseEntity in case of invalid data with HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST

        @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/deleteFloor",
                method=DELETE)
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DataRepresentationBackend.Models.Message> deleteFloor(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                           DataRepresentationBackend.Models.SingleObject floor)
        method that gives the posibility to delete a entire floor
        Parameters:
        floor - - SingleObject
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - a Message and HttpStatus.OK or a ResponseEntity that contains a significant message and HttpStatus.CONFLICT in case of SQLException or a ResponseEntity in case of Exception that contains a significant Message and HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR or a ResponseEntity in case of invalid data with HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST

 @ResponseBody

        Parameters:
        room - - SingleObject that represent a room from the building
        Returns:

      • deleteTemporaryData

        @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/delete",
                method=DELETE)
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DataRepresentationBackend.Models.Message> deleteTemporaryData(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                              DataRepresentationBackend.Models.TemporaryData data)
        DELETE method that erase element of the building from the database
        Parameters:
        data - - BodyType: JSon { "elementType" : 6, "room" : "C210", "x1" : 1, "y1" : 2, "x2" : 3, "y2" : 4, "floor" : 5, "isExitWay" : 0, "isExterior": 0 }
        Returns:
        HttpStatus.OK if element is added to database or a ResponseEntity in case of OperationNotSupportedException that contains a significant message and HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST or a ResponseEntity in case of Exception that contains a significant Message and HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR or a ResponseEntity in case of invalid data with HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST

      • getXML

        @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/getXML",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<?> getXML()
        GET method that returns the XML Document needed for the representation of the building and for the pathfinding
        Returns:
        HttpEntity - the XML document and a HttpHeader which has information about the content type and length or a ResponseEntity in case of Exception that contains a significant Message and HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR

      • temporarySave

        @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/finalSave",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DataRepresentationBackend.Models.TemporarySaveMessage> temporarySave()
        POST method that make the final save. After validating the temporary elements, they are saved into the final form
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - a message and HttpStatus.OK or a ResponseEntity that contains a significant message and HttpStatus.CONFLICT in case of SQLException or a ResponseEntity in case of Exception that contains a significant Message and HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
